data.title: Thomas Thurston (abt.1633-1704)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for Thomas Thurston born abt. 1633 Wrentham, Suffolk, England died 1704 Medfield, Norfolk, Massachusetts Bay Province including ancestors + descendants + 1 genealogist comments + mitochondrial DNA + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Profile last modified 15 Oct 2022 | Created 30 Aug 2010

This page has been accessed 2,315 times.

Contents

1 Biography

2 LIfe and Death in Medfield

2.1 Marriage

2.2 Children

3 Sources

Biography

Baptized 4 August 1633 in Wrentham, Suffolk, England[1]

LIfe and Death in Medfield

Thomas was Medfield's Captain, and also surveyed of lands in Sherborn. He was Town Clerk for six years, kept school for two years, and served as Selectman for ten years.

Thomas's house was burned in the Indian attack on Medfield in February 1676, and two of his children were mortally wounded in that attack.[2]

Marriage

Thomas Thurston and Sarah Thaxter were married in Medfield on 13 December 1655. [3][4]

Children

Thomas and Sarah had children born in Medfield:[5]

John , b. March 4, 1655-1666

Thomas, b. February 11, 1657-1658, settled in Wrentham

Nathaniel, b. January 24, 1660

Sarah, b. September 16, 1662, married Samuel Morse

Mary, b. March 17, 1664-1665

Margaret, b. August 9, 1668, died 1676 of wounds

Elizabeth, b. September 19, 1671, m. Charles Ramsey

Samuel, b. August 4, 1674, died in 1676 of wounds

Margaret, b. March 30, 1677-1678

Thomas Thurston died a widower in Medfield on 20 May 1704. His wife Sarah Thaxter Thurston had died in 1678.[6][7]

Sources
